servinfo.title: DTC P0638: Inlet Throttle Valve Control Range / Performance

attention2.ptxt: This fault can result in a rapid and significant fouling of the diesel particulate filter.

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying fault finding procedures to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after:
The engine is started.
A road test.
Output test “Electronic Throttle valve” on SUZUKI scan tool.
Turning OFF ignition switch and waiting 40 seconds.
If the fault is present:
It is difficult or even impossible to start the vehicle.
The engine stops noisily.
The Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.
Use service wire for all operations on the ECM connectors.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (DSL) .

entry.ptxt: Short circuit to vehicle body ground

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC1: Short circuit to +12 V

attention3.ptxt: After any inlet throttle valve procedures, it is necessary to perform “Initialize inlet throttle valve data” on SUZUKI scan tool. Then turn OFF ignition switch and wait 40 seconds.

entry.ptxt: Check the connections of the inlet throttle valve.
Check the continuity and insulation from +12 V of the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C75-1” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and vehicle body ground
Between “C75-3” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-40” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C75-4” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-27” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault persists, replace the inlet throttle valve.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC0: Short circuit to vehicle body ground and CO: Open circuit

attention3.ptxt: After any inlet throttle valve procedures, it is necessary to perform “Initialize inlet throttle valve data” on SUZUKI scan tool.
Inlet throttle valve fault adaptives. Then turn OFF ignition switch and wait 40 seconds.

entry.ptxt: Check the connections of the inlet throttle valve.
Check the continuity and insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C75-3” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-40” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C75-2” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “E33-6” wire of main relay mounting connector
Between “C75-4” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-27” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault persists, replace the inlet throttle valve.

attention3.ptxt: After any inlet throttle valve procedures, it is necessary to perform “Initialize inlet throttle valve data” on SUZUKI scan tool.
Inlet throttle valve fault adaptives. Then turn OFF ignition switch and wait 40 seconds.

entry.ptxt: Check the connections of the inlet throttle valve.
Check the continuity, absence of interference resistance and insulation on the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C75-1” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and vehicle body ground
Between “C75-2” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “E33-6” wire of main relay mounting connector
Between “C75-3” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-40” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C75-4” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-27” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault persists, replace the inlet throttle valve.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for D1: Internal electronic fault, D2: External diagnostics and D3: Values out of range

attention3.ptxt: After any inlet throttle valve procedures, it is necessary to perform “Initialize inlet throttle valve data” on SUZUKI scan tool.
Inlet throttle valve fault adaptives. Then turn OFF ignition switch and wait 40 seconds.

entry.ptxt: Check the connections of the inlet throttle valve.
Check the continuity, absence of interference resistance and insulation on the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C75-1” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and vehicle body ground
Between “C75-2” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “E33-6” wire of main relay mounting connector
Between “C75-3” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-40” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C75-4” wire of inlet throttle valve connector and “C86-27” terminal of ECM connector
Perform “Initialize inlet throttle valve data” on SUZUKI scan tool.
If the fault is still present, check that the ECM output stage is working correctly.
Connected inlet throttle valve:
Connect the negative terminal of the voltmeter to “C75-3” wire of the inlet throttle valve
Connect the positive terminal of the voltmeter to “C75-2” wire of the inlet throttle valve
Perform output test “Electronic Throttle Control” on SUZUKI scan tool:

entry.ptxt: The voltmeter should display five cycles of two successive voltages: ~ 3.15 V (Opening Cyclic Ratio of 25%) then ~ 9.45V (Opening Cyclic Ratio of 75%).
If the voltmeter indicates above voltage, but inlet throttle valve does not operate, replace inlet throttle valve.
If the voltmeter does not indicate any control while the command is running (five cycles), substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
